conclusion: To determine which car has the greater acceleration, analyze the graph showing the variation of the square of the velocities with displacement.

The image displays a graph with velocity squared (v²) on the vertical axis and displacement (x) on the horizontal axis. Two lines, labeled A and B, represent the motion of two cars. Line A has a steeper slope than line B.
The acceleration of an object in uniform accelerated motion is related to the slope of the graph of velocity squared versus displacement.
Observe the graph, which plots v² against x.
Note that line A has a greater slope than line B.
According to the relationship between acceleration and slope, the greater the slope, the greater the acceleration.
Therefore, Car A, represented by line A, has a greater acceleration than Car B, represented by line B.
Car A has the greater acceleration.
